section.title: Releases and Snapshots
section.para:
What is a release from the Maven point of view? The Maven Way is about to start with a version which has a -SNAPSHOT postfix added. This identifies this version as a so called SNAPSHOT-release
To be honest the word release in this case does not make really sense. Let use assume the following SNAPSHOT-release 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT. You can deploy a SNAPSHOT-release everytime you changed something in your project which also can be used as a dependency in other projects. Everytime you deploy an other SNAPSHOT this means the earlier one will get invalid. But based on the SNAPSHOT identity you can't be sure which exact state of your project this SNAPSHOT represents. So SNAPSHOT's are only intended during the development. After you have finished your development you will make a release out of it. This will change the earlier mentioned 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT into 1.0.0.
